intro: Stigmaphyllon ecuadorense, commonly known as the Ecuadorian stigmaphyllon, is a flowering plant native to the Andean regions of Ecuador. It belongs to the Malvaceae family, which includes hibiscus and cotton. The plant is characterized by its palmate leaves and showy, pentagonal flowers that are typically pink or red. It thrives in humid, shaded environments at high altitudes. Due to its ornamental value and limited distribution, it is of interest to botanists and conservationists.
